However, he is not alone - his three closest friends, Rosy, Rukshan, and Suresh, stand by his side. Their strong friendship, supported by understanding teachers, is anchored in the motto "One for all - All for one," which echoes throughout the film. One day, Wishma learns that his father might still be alive. Excited and full of hope, he shares this with his friends. As he dreams about meeting his father again, a mysterious woman appears. She warns him to use them wisely and never for selfish reasons, and tells him that each wish lasts only seven days. Initially, the children laugh it off, believing it to be nothing more than a fairy tale. But that same day, after being humiliated once again by older boys, Wishma, in frustration, uses one of the wishes and asks to become grown-up immediately. He falls asleep with this wish in his heart. The next morning, he wakes up to find he has transformed into an adult overnight. Even his own mother fails to recognize him. Scared and confused, Wishma runs away and turns to his friends for help. Together, they realize the magical wish has come true. Now determined to use the remaining powers to reunite his mother and father, Wishma embarks on a heartfelt journey - a series of magical, adventurous, and emotionally rich events unfold, where love, curiosity, and wonder intertwine to bring a fractured family back together.
